  16. /* A dictionary data structure implemented as skip lists */

  18. /* Keys and associated data are natural-width integers (type [uintnat]).
  19.    Pointers can be used too, modulo conversion to [uintnat]. */

  21. #ifndef CAML_SKIPLIST_H
  22. ‌#define CAML_SKIPLIST_H

  24. #ifdef CAML_INTERNALS

  26. #include "config.h"

  28. ‌#define NUM_LEVELS 17

  30. /* The head of a skip list */

  32. ‌struct skiplist {
  33.   struct skipcell * forward[NUM_LEVELS]; /* forward chaining */
  34.   int level;                    /* max level used */
  35. };

  37. /* The cells of a skip list */

  39. ‌struct skipcell {
  40.   uintnat key;
  41.   uintnat data;
  42. #if (__STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L)
  43.   struct skipcell * forward[];  /* variable-length array */
  44. #else
  45.   struct skipcell * forward[1]; /* variable-length array */
  46. #endif
  47. };

  49. /* Initialize a skip list, statically */
  50. ‌#define SKIPLIST_STATIC_INITIALIZER { {0, }, 0 }

  52. /* Initialize a skip list, dynamically */
  53. extern void caml_skiplist_init(struct skiplist * sk);

  55. /* Search a skip list.
  56.    If [key] is found, store associated data in [*data] and return 1.
  57.    If [key] is not found, return 0 and leave [*data] unchanged. */
  58. extern int caml_skiplist_find(struct skiplist * sk, uintnat key,
  59.                               /*out*/ uintnat * data);

  61. /* Search the entry of the skip list that has the largest key less than
  62.    or equal to [k].
  63.    If such an entry exists, store its key in [*key], the associated data in
  64.    [*data], and return 1.
  65.    If no such entry exists (all keys in the skip list are strictly greater
  66.    than [k]), return 0 and leave [*key] and [*data] unchanged. */
  67. extern int caml_skiplist_find_below(struct skiplist * sk, uintnat k,
  68.                                     /*out*/ uintnat * key,
  69.                                     /*out*/ uintnat * data);

  71. /* Insertion in a skip list.
  72.    If [key] was already there, change the associated data and return 1.
  73.    If [key] was not there, insert new [key, data] binding and return 0. */
  74. extern int caml_skiplist_insert(struct skiplist * sk,
  75.                                 uintnat key, uintnat data);

  77. /* Deletion in a skip list.
  78.    If [key] was there, remove it and return 1.
  79.    If [key] was not there, leave the skip list unchanged and return 0. */
  80. extern int caml_skiplist_remove(struct skiplist * sk, uintnat key);

  82. /* Empty an already initialized skip list. */
  83. extern void caml_skiplist_empty(struct skiplist * sk);

  85. /* Iterate over a skip list, in increasing order of keys.
  86.    [var] designates the current element.
  87.    [action] can refer to [var->key] and [var->data].
  88.    [action] can safely remove the current element, i.e. call
  89.    [caml_skiplist_remove] on [var->key].  The traversal will
  90.    continue with the skiplist element following the removed element.
  91.    Other operations performed over the skiplist during its traversal have
  92.    unspecified effects on the traversal. */

  94. ‌#define FOREACH_SKIPLIST_ELEMENT(var,sk,action) \
  95.   { struct skipcell * var, * caml__next; \
  96.     for (var = (sk)->forward[0]; var != NULL; var = caml__next) \
  97.     { caml__next = (var)->forward[0]; action; } \
  98.   }

  100. #endif

  102. #endif
